lifecycle.name: PLANNING
lifecycle.summary: Produces an approved implementation plan before any code is written. Explores the codebase, drafts a plan, reviews it, and gets human approval.

phase.name: INTAKE
phase.actor: Orchestrator launches an Explorer agent (reasoning tier)

actions.action: Explore the codebase: relevant source files, existing patterns, dependencies
Explore existing documentation (code is source of truth — docs may be outdated)
When docs contradict code, flag the discrepancy in the context report
Return a context report to the orchestrator

phase.name: DRAFT
phase.actor: Orchestrator launches a Planner agent (reasoning tier)

actions.action: Receive the Explorer's context report and the ticket details
Break the work into sub-tasks. For each sub-task, provide: - Description of what to do - Files to modify - Acceptance criteria - Complexity rating: light / standard / complex
Identify dependencies between sub-tasks (which must complete before others)
Return the plan to the orchestrator

phase.name: REVIEW
phase.actor: Orchestrator launches a Plan Reviewer agent (reasoning tier)

actions.action: Receive the Planner's plan and the original ticket
Check: does the plan cover all acceptance criteria?
Raise any questions or concerns to the orchestrator

phase.name: HUMAN_GATE
phase.actor: Orchestrator presents the plan to the human

presents.item: The sub-task list with complexity ratings
Any concerns raised by the reviewer

phase.gate: BLOCKED — Do not proceed. Human approval required before implementation.
phase.on-rejection: Orchestrator feeds corrections back to the Planner → loop to DRAFT

phase.name: HANDOFF
phase.action: Post the approved plan as a comment on the ticket (sub-task-tracking behavior)
